name: Rainbow Retreat Wilderness Eco Cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving in St Mary on a Sunday evening after a delayed flight we found every shop/café closed in the village and no possibility to eat at the hotel. That was a bit disappointing for a start.
reviews.title: Wont' find a better start to a trip in Tasmania !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily we finally found a good steack at the Pub and so we could start enjoying the peaceful atmosphere of Tasmania...
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean, there was a large choices of wine in the mini-bar as well as some food for the wild animals.
reviews.title: Strongly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw and fed a lot of wallabies, a wombat and more. It was so cute!
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During the night you can enjoy the heat from the stove in your room and relax while watching the wonderful sky full of stars. You really feel away from civilization, surrounded by wilderness and silence.
reviews.title: This is a wonderful experience, peaceful, beautiful, with fabulous views

aka: Rainbow Retreat Wilderness Eco Cabins Tasmania/St Marys, Australia
description: Rainbow Retreat overlooks the Bay of Fires - we have the most sensational ocean panorama in all of Tasmania. The retreat sits within St Patricks Head Private Nature Reserve; you can see for 230 km along the expansive eastern coastline of Tasmania. Voted the best eco retreat and private nature reserve in Tasmania. Rainbow Retreat is a comfortable drive from Freycinet National Park, Wine Glass Bay, Ben Lomond National Park, and the beautiful Douglas Apsley National Park, so why stay in the cold wet and windy south of Tasmania when you can stay on the sun coast, the warm region of Tasmania, local holiday destination for many Tasmanians? The property has been proclaimed by the Tasmanian government as a private nature reserve, the highest conservation listing available. If you are expecting a resort, you will be disappointed as we are a nature retreat; we prefer to cater to nature-based travellers who appreciate the beauty of staying in a true carbon neutral Eco retreat. Rainbow Retreat offers an Eco tourism experience for those of us who enjoy the pleasures of comfort as well as being able to appreciate the sheer beauty of nature combined with the most sensational ocean views, which almost engulfs the visitor. We have three very comfortable solar powered Eco cabins with the most sensational ocean panorama in all of Tasmania, we are 600 metres above sea level on the historical St Patricks Head Private Nature Reserve. The open plan cabins are timber-lined and appointed with a queen size bed, a full kitchen and a spacious en-suite bathroom, a pot-belly heater, dining suite, and LED colour TV, prepare your own meals or enjoy the convenience of choosing a specialty dish from our in-house menu, meals are prepared by our in-house chef, delivered fresh to your cabin. Please place food orders prior to your stay. The cabins run on 12-volt solar. We recommend taking out travel insurance!
